channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed

item.title: There's a massive Black Friday Lego sale at Amazon – here are 21 deals I'd buy from $6.99
item.description: From epic Star Wars sets to Disney, Botanicals, Creator 3-in-1s, and even an Advent Calendar in between, Amazon is discounting Lego sets by more than 40% for Black Friday, and you can get an excellent Lego for as little as $6.99.

item.title: Google says hackers stole data from 200 companies following Gainsight breach
item.description: Notorious hacking collective Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters takes credit for the breach that affected Salesforce customers’ data, and said it is planning another extortion campaign.

item.title: ‘Jungle Cruise 2’ Has Gone Over the Falls, According to Its Stars
item.description: Dwayne Johnson and Emily Blunt don't think a rumored sequel to the 2021 film is going to happen.

item.title: X begins rolling out the ‘About this account’ feature to users’ profiles
item.description: The feature will show where users are based, how they're connected to X, and how many times they've changed their username.

item.title: Who is AI nostalgia slop even for?
item.description: There has been a recent deluge of generative AI videos featuring uncannily fresh-faced teens waxing nostalgic about how much better the world was during the '80s and '90s. As the AI youths smize and show off their period-specific haircuts, the clips cut to dreamlike footage of sun-drenched cul-de-sacs and vintage cars while songs like "Everybody […]...

item.title: Why did Apple kill ICE tracking apps? Activists are determined to find out

item.title: Mullvad VPN adds ultra-fast obfuscation to beat WireGuard blocking
item.description: Mullvad VPN adds Lightweight WireGuard Obfuscation (LWO), a new ultra-light obfuscation protocol designed to hide WireGuard traffic and bypass censorship with almost no speed loss.

item.title: Google Chrome is testing a big change to tabs
item.description: Google's Chrome browser is getting an upgrade in the form of vertical tabs.

item.title: Xiaomi va rendre ses voitures électriques plus sûres grâce à ces nouvelles technologies
item.description: À l'occasion du salon de Guangzhou, Xiaomi annonce renforcer la sécurité de ses voitures électriques. La marque chinoise officialise le déploiement de son système de conduite semi-autonome HAD en version améliorée, accompagné d'une refonte complète de ses aides à la conduite.

item.title: Brendan Fraser Says the Death of ‘Batgirl’ Was About Commodifying ‘Content’
item.description: The star is still just as heated about Warner Bros. canning 'Batgirl' years later, and you know what, he's right.

item.title: Trump administration plans to open new oil drilling off of California and Florida coasts, sparking bipartisan backlash
item.description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom called the proposal ‘idiotic’ while Florida representatives urged the administration to reconsider. The Trump administration announced on Thursday new oil drilling off the California and Florida coasts for the first time in decades, advancing a project that critics say could harm coastal communities and ecosystems, as President Donald Trump seeks to expand U.S. oil production....

item.title: Senators Want Extremism Researchers to Surrender Documents Linked to Right-Wing Grudges
item.description: The Senate homeland security committee's chair has asked researchers to turn over troves of documents related to the January 6 attack, vaccines, and more, according to a letter reviewed by WIRED.

item.title: Impersonators are (still) targeting companies with fake TechCrunch outreach
item.description: Fraudsters are impersonating TechCrunch reporters and event leads, and reaching out to companies. Here's what we're doing about it, and what you can look out for.

item.title: TikTok users can’t stop complaining about ‘type B’ coworkers
item.description: The classic personality polarity is making the rounds in viral social media skits. “POV: You have a type B coworker,” TikTok creator Eric Sedeño posted last week. In the viral skit, the “coworker” rolls into the office past 10 a.m., pulling out a laptop with only 5% charge.

item.title: La Black Friday Week casse les prix des smartphones : les meilleures offres à moins de 300 € dont le Pixel 9a et le CMF Phone 2 Pro
